channel.title: WWU Cybersecurity Club
channel.description: Recent content on WWU Cybersecurity Club

item.title: How to Edit This Site
item.description: This site is created using the Hugo static site generator. Hugo accepts Markdown and translates it into HTML/CSS/JS based on the provided theme. This site uses the terminal theme. Terminal has some theme-specific features, which are detailed in the previous link. How to build this site: Firstly, make sure that you’re using a recent version of Hugo. The version shipped in Debian stable is too old for our purposes. The author is using v0.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Blogs & News Krebs on Security Cisco Talos Kayne McGladrey Arstechnica Daniel Miessler Phoronix Ycombinator HackerNews Programming and Computer Science: Tutorials and Resources Programming Codecademy Learn You a Haskell Computer Science and Operating Systems Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces Computer Networks: A Systems Approach Linux Academy (requires a (free) account) Resource Dumps What Every CS Student Should Know Open Source Computer Science Degree Curated Programming Resources OWASP Security Cheatsheet Security Portswigger Academy (Webapp Pentesting) Cloud AWS Training Tools & Other Markdown Tutorial Github Git Handbook The Git Book (overkill for beginners) Vimtutor: If you’ve installed vim, simply run vimtutor in your shell

item.title: Western Washington University Cybersecurity Club
item.description: Welcome to the Cybersecurity Club! We’re looking forward to having a great year in 2020 & 2021. Check out the calendar page for our future activities. Our plans for this year include: * Capture-the-Flag competitions and CCDC practice * CCNA and networking study sessions * Creating virtual testing environments on top of physical hardware * Trips to visit security companies & teams * Internship and job-seeking guidance, resume reviews, etc
